intro: [WRONG START] Embilia acuta, commonly known as the sharpleaf embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and thickets. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its native ecosystem.
